repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Resolves #19884

- Adding ++p option to write ex command will create the parent directories of the file if they don't exist 
(example: `:write ++p foo/bar/baz.txt`)
- Same behavior applies for the writefile() function (example: `writefile(..., 'foo/bar/baz.txt', 'p'`)
- This flag can be seen via `v:cmdarg`

I've been trying to find meaningful tests to write but haven't figured out where I should write them. Any guidance on that would be greatly appreciated.

comment_data.body:
Trying to think of a more conventional name. Could do something like `os_file_ensure_dir` but I think this works:

```suggestion
int os_file_mkdir(char *fname)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -946,6 +946,31 @@ int os_mkdir_recurse(const char *const dir, int32_t mode, char **const failed_di
   return 0;
 }
 
+/// Create the parent directory of a file if it does not exist
+///
+/// @param[in] fname Full path of the file name whose parent directories
+///                  we want to create
+///
+/// @return `0` for success, libuv error code for failure.
+int os_mkdir_if_absent(char *fname)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  it("++p creates missing parent directories", function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,6 +97,16 @@ describe(':write', function()
     fifo:close()
   end)
 
+  it("creates missing parent directories", function()

comment_data.body: is it enough to just check filereadable()? (and check that it is NOT readable before the ++p step). Then we can skip the source() part.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,6 +97,16 @@ describe(':write', function()
     fifo:close()
   end)
 
+  it("creates missing parent directories", function()
+    command("write ++p test/write/p_opt.txt")
+    source([[
+      edit test/write/p_opt.txt
+      call setline(1, ['line1'])
+      write
+    ]])
+    eq(eval("['line1']"), eval("readfile('test/write/p_opt.txt')"))

comment_data.body:
Let's also test some edge cases like:

```
command("write ++p test/")
command("write ++p /")
command("write ++p .")
command("write ++p ./p_opt.txt")
command("write ++p p_opt.txt")
```

These could live in the same it().
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,6 +97,16 @@ describe(':write', function()
     fifo:close()
   end)
 
+  it("creates missing parent directories", function()
+    command("write ++p test/write/p_opt.txt")

comment_data.body: I used `STRCAT` here instead of `strcat` to keep consistency in the code since that macro was previously used for the ++edit option as well
Alright, I was also wondering if it would be best to also pass the file mode as a parameter ? It's hard coded here and set to `0755`, perhaps it'd be better to actually have it as a parameter ?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -946,6 +946,31 @@ int os_mkdir_recurse(const char *const dir, int32_t mode, char **const failed_di
   return 0;
 }
 
+/// Create the parent directory of a file if it does not exist
+///
+/// @param[in] fname Full path of the file name whose parent directories
+///                  we want to create
+///
+/// @return `0` for success, libuv error code for failure.
+int os_mkdir_if_absent(char *fname)

comment_data.body: Are all these edge cases supposed to pass ? I'm a bit confused because using the `:write` excmd to create an empty directory seems a bit weird to me. You might as well just use `:!mkdir` if you simply want to create an empty directory imo
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,6 +97,16 @@ describe(':write', function()
     fifo:close()
   end)
 
+  it("creates missing parent directories", function()
+    command("write ++p test/write/p_opt.txt")

comment_data.body: no, they're just checking that `os_file_mkdir` can handle weird inputs
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -94,6 +97,16 @@ describe(':write', function()
     fifo:close()
   end)
 
+  it("creates missing parent directories", function()
+    command("write ++p test/write/p_opt.txt")

comment_data.body: if STRCAT is used where it isn't needed that's just code that hasn't been cleaned up. We don't want to repeat that pattern in new code :)

> also pass the file mode as a parameter ?

sure, a parameter to os_file_mkdir() is a good idea. But not as a parameter to `:write`  (maybe a followup PR/feature-request, idk).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -946,6 +946,31 @@ int os_mkdir_recurse(const char *const dir, int32_t mode, char **const failed_di
   return 0;
 }
 
+/// Create the parent directory of a file if it does not exist
+///
+/// @param[in] fname Full path of the file name whose parent directories
+///                  we want to create
+///
+/// @return `0` for success, libuv error code for failure.
+int os_mkdir_if_absent(char *fname)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
  it('writefile(...,"p") creates missing parent directories', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -111,6 +111,26 @@ describe('writefile()', function()
        pcall_err(command, ('call writefile([42], %s)'):format(ddname_tail)))
   end)
 
+  it('creates missing parent directories', function()

comment_regular_data.body:
> I've been trying to find meaningful tests to write but haven't figured out where I should write them

`./test/functional/ex_cmds/edit_spec.lua` looks like the right place.
Shouldn't it be `ex_cmds/write_spec.lua` or some other file (`core/fileio_spec.lua`?) related to writing?
Would a PR be accepted to add `++p` to `:wa`, `:x` and co?
@bobrippling sounds great to me, I also noticed that `:update ++p` doesn't work though it's kind of a different issue. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/35145

> @bobrippling sounds great to me, I also noticed that `:update ++p` doesn't work though it's a kind of a different issue. #35145

Great - opened #20835

title: feat: add ++p option
